portfolio.title: Portfolio website .M
portfolio.desc1: This is my first personal portfolio website. A website that in a way represents me, and showcases what I am all about. To build this website I used HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Angular framework. It is devided in different sections: short intro, projects, about me and get in touch sections. Each section has it's own characteristics.

sections.title: Project section
sections.desc: Section to showcase projects done by me, as well as the projects that are on their way. Each card represents a different project and it is a link to a page that gives more info about the displayed project as well as screenshots or videos of the project. To  make the section more suitable for the viewer each odd/even card is colored differently.

sections.title: About me section
sections.desc: About me section gives full details about the developer (me). It is a section that gives a chance to personaly get to know the author a little better. It contains the subsection to showcase all the technologies that the author enjoys learning and using to create applications.

sections.title: Project page
sections.desc: Project page gives a full description of the selected project. It showcases most of the project sections and describes their use, as well as it provides links to Github repository of the project and live demo links if they exist. This page includes mockup images of websites or aplications, as well as full list of technologies used to build it.

oggyportfolio.title: Portfolio website Oggy
oggyportfolio.desc1: This was the first project I worked on while learning Angular framework. I was inspired to do a personal portfolio presentation because I wanted the experience of making a personal website. All images used for this project are not my own property, but borrowed from the internet.

sections.title: About me section
sections.desc: About me section gives full details about the developer. It is a section that gives a chance to personaly get to know the author a little better. It contains the subsection to showcase all the technologies that the author enjoys learning and using to create applications.

sections.title: Project section
sections.desc: Section to showcase projects done by me, as well as the projects that are on their way. Each card represents a different project and it is a link to a page that gives more info about the displayed project. To  make the section more suitable for the viewer each odd/even card is colored differently.

sections.title: Project page
sections.desc: Project page gives a full description of the selected project. It showcases most of the project sections and describes their use, as well as it provides links to Github repository of the project and live demo links. This page includes mockup images of websites or aplications, as well as full list of technologies used to build it.

pophelanke.title: Pop helanke web shop
pophelanke.desc1: This project was a school project, done as an assignment while learning PHP and implementing JavaScript knowledge. The assignment was to build a website using an existing HTML and CSS theme and implementing Javascript functions as well as communication with Database via ajax and php.

sections.title: Index page
sections.desc: Index page is a typical home page for a webshop, showcasing offers, collections and categories to look through. Each section is a link for another page that displays the category coresponding to the section.

sections.title: Shop section
sections.desc: Shop section offers user a possibility to filter the leggings by the category, color or price. Each product can be added to cart, but the cart will be accessible only to logged in users. The items are shown in rows and each time a user decides on the filter new query is made, and the results are used to load new page contents.

sections.title: Shopping cart
sections.desc: Shopping cart page is accessible only to logged in users. The page gets populated with content once the user has some items placed in the cart. Here, user can decide weather to delete some items from the cart or to keep them in the cart. If the user adds more items to the cart, there is a button for updating the cart so all items are updated.

viaolivia.title: Via Olivia web shop
viaolivia.desc1: This is a project I am currently working on. It is a webshop for different kinds of food products.

sections.title: Under construction page
sections.desc: This page is not an usual under construction page, but a page to let people know when the shop will be opened and give them an opportunity to subscribe to a newsletter and get notified once the shop is fully functioning or there are any other news. Mailerlite is implemented to be used as a newsletter subscription app.

stretchingapp.title: Stretching web app
stretchingapp.desc1: This is a project that is still in the planing phase. It will be a web app intended for everyone and anyone who wants to stretch their body. It will have easy step by step guides and follow along tutorials so that everyone is able to use it easily.

melog.title: Personal diary application - MeLog
melog.desc1: This is my biggest project I made so far. It was a finishing project for the Computer Science batchelor degree. I personly picked the theme because journaling is something I enjoy, and I wanted to make a web app that has the features that I am using and couldn't find in other apps online.

sections.title: Landing page
sections.desc: Landing page is there to represent the whole project to future users. It is divided in sections, and each section represents one feature of the diary app. Underneath each section there is a hook button for an easy access to register or login page.

sections.title: User Profile
sections.desc: User profile can be accessed after successful login, or register process. It is a personal diary profile that contains multiple different options for user. A user can log and track their: mood, energy, sleep hours, water intake, weather they worked out or not, how many steps did they take, what they are grateful for and write a day log. All of these options are placed in cards that have an option to be turned off, if the user doesn't want to track that option.

sections.title: Charts page
sections.desc: Tracking anything wouldn't make any sense if we didn't have an option to analyze the tracked data. This is why a user can access the chart representation of their own logs. They can track their progress through time and get a visual representation in the form of line chart or pie chart. They can also filter the data in any way that is more suitable for them.

sections.title: Day logs
sections.desc: MeLog app couldn't be called a diary if it only had an option to track different things. This is why any user can actually use day log card to write their on diary logs, and add images. Any user can review their past logs, filter them, and access a separate page for displaying the log where they can change it or decide to delete it.

sections.title: Gratitude logs
sections.desc: Gratitude log is meant to motivate a user to start writing a gratitude diary and by doing that the user is working on being more mindful and present. Just like with Day Logs user can review all past Gratitude logs and delete any if they want.

sections.title: Profile settings page
sections.desc: Every user, after logging in process, has access to Profile settings page. Here they can change their personal data, as well as add, change or remove profile images. They can change password, and decide if they want to turn on or off any profile option. Lastly they can also leave a review of the app, and choose weather they want it to be anonymous or not.

sections.title: Admin page
sections.desc: Admin page is accessible only to logged in users who also have an admin role. Admins can change the view of the user profile by changing the icons used to represent different options. They can add or delete welcoming images. They can change, add or delete inspirational quotes and affirmations that are showed to user. And they can make new admin user or remove admin role from another admin.

video.title: App video
video.desc: This is an app walktrough video I made with a purpose of presenting my work. Please take time and see all the app features to get a better understanding of app functionalities.
